Colony Navigator Help
 
 
 To select a colony, touch the colony text field. Enter its colony number and then press either the Go button on the keyboard or the OK button to the right of the text field to select the colony.
 
 When a colony is selected, the map view will display three red triangles pointing to the selected colony. A purple line will be drawn from your current location to the selected colony. You can follow this line to get to the selected colony.
 
 Position accuracy: The techniques used to map the location from GPS coordinates to local colony coordinates are good but not perfect. Generally, the map view will show your location accurately. The exception is when you are near the south edge of the research site. Near the south edge, the map view will think that you are north of where you actually are.
 
 To edit the data of a colony, type its number in the colony field and press the Edit button. A view will open where you can check the checkboxes to signify that you have visited this colony and if the colony is active. Press the OK button to save your changes. Press the cancel button to discard your changes.
 
 
 To exit the help view and return to the main application, press the horizontal U-turn symbol button in the bottom left corner of the screen.
